fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new user
# Login as the new user, visit Confluence

h3. Result:

* New user does not appear in Confluence people directory, and also other user picker features that use this index e.g. team calendars and page restrictions
* A reindex of Confluence does not fix the problem
* The USERINFO row for the new user is not even created in the CONTENT table of Confluence

Note that this does not happen in Confluence-only OnDemand instances.

See this knowledge base article: [Existing Users do not Appear in Confluence People Directory, Team Calendars, Share Feature and Watchers List|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Existing+Users+do+not+Appear+in+Confluence+People+Directory%2C+Team+Calendars%2C+Share+Feature+and+Watchers+List]

fields.description:
The the JIRA 5.0 upgrade we did also brings in Crowd 2.3.6. The other apps are using Crowd <= 2.3.4. Because of [CWD-2752 |https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2752] this means that when developing a Mac logging into JIRA would not create a SSO token that could also log into the other applications. Mac will use IPv6 for localhost and for some reason reports the local address as ::1%0.

To work around this for the time being I am going to tell all the apps to use IPv4 in preference to IPv6 by adding -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true. Unicorn uses IPv4 so this should not be a problem. 

We can remove this hack once all the applications go to or past Crowd Embedded 2.3.5 or Crowd Integration Client 2.3.5.

REF: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2752
fields.summary: Remove -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true hack from pom

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian

Why top tabs are called "Issues", "Wiki", "Source" instead of "JIRA", "Confluence" etc? I see downsides here:
* inside OnDemand there is no way to tell what is JIRA and what is Confluence, so when your new customers buy something - they don't know what they really got
* You're loosing your well known and recognized brand of JIRA, as there is no mention of it inside the system. 

There is an obvious benefit of having it less confusing for newcomers so they know where is the wiki system and where is the issues tracker, but if they bought it already, they may know that JIRA means issues and Confluence means wiki, right?
fields.summary: rename "Issues", "Wiki", "Source" to "JIRA", "Confluence" etc

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian

Have an idea on overall OnDemand admin dashboard organisation. Current OnDemand administration dashboard for an experienced JIRA user looks messed up, ([more details|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-28764]), however I see reasons why it was done this way. But also I see a way to solve this better. 

Right now OnDemand admin dashboard is really a merged JIRA, Confluence and other systems dashboards under a set of tabs like *General*, *Issues*, *Wiki*, *Source*. And inside each tab all administration blocks and pages that were nicely structured in the original JIRA system are merged into one big an not effective list. For example having "User Interface" under "Issues" tab is quite unobvious an if I wouldn't know the original JIRA system well - it would give me hard times to find it.
Also notice that all tabs inside the administration completely match the tabs in the top of the page, *Issues*, *Wiki*, *Source*, *Reviews* are also there (except for *General* but it's not a problem).
So, the solution is - to implement a similar "Administration mode" in the OnDemand as it is in JIRA, when these main tabs will act as switching between the administration parts instead of system parts itself. And a link to "exit administration" as it is in JIRA. And below these main tabs you could place usual JIRA and other systems dashboards tabs in same way and structure as it is in standalone JIRA. This way you will both keep the interface consistency between standalone and merged systems and also eliminate need to maintain another completely different interface. 

Please let me know if there is any discussion thread or more details on it elsewhere, I'd like to get more involved.


Alex.
fields.summary: OnDeman admin dashboard reorganise

fields.summary: Create user on Jira OnDemand returns a NullPointerException

fields.description: When someone tries to add 11 users to FE under a 10 user license, the message "Could not update users in FishEye/Crucible" is displayed. A message saying why (that is, because there were too many users) should be displayed instead.
fields.summary: When attempting to add too many users to an application access screen, a useful message should be displayed

fields.description:
To reproduce: 
1. go to /secure/admin/user/BulkAddApplicationAccess!default.jspa
2. select more users than you have licenses for in a non-jira app
3. submit.

The page will return with an error (as expected) but JIRA will be selected as the app to add the users to and the other app(s) will not.
fields.summary: Failed Bulk Add Application Access always selects JIRA, regardless of attempted app additions

fields.description:
Time zones are a concept driven by the political situation in each country around the world. As such, they change frequently, and often at short notice.

All applications in OnDemand uses joda-time. When time zone needs to be updated, the user needs to go to download the time zone data, download the source code from joda-time, replacing the outdated time zone data from the source, recompile the jar, and rename it.

In OnDemand, it also means support needs to place the jar in the WEB-INF/lib directory for all applications, and make sure this does not get overridden when new releases of OnDemand are rolled out.

We can probably introduce a step in OnDemand build and/or product build to download the latest time zone data, invoke {{org.joda.time.tz.ZoneInfoCompiler}} to compile them into joda-time binary format, and jar them (possibly into a new jar and have an atlassian joda-time jar that has timezone binary ripped out), and package them into the war files.
fields.summary: As an OnDemand customer, I would like time zone data to be always up-to-date

fields.description: Maybe add a default tab or something more visible for it when it's installed.
fields.summary: Make the Team Calendar more prominent when it is added on the instance

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 16 November 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. We would love to learn more about how you use audit logs. We appreciate if you could please fill out our short survey [here.|https://goo.gl/forms/WP0XIu3bwGGEaK5g1]

Your feedback is key to helping us understand how we can continue improving your experience with our products. 

Thanks,
 Rak Garg
 Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}
For audit reasons customers would like to have an administration change log so they can track the people who made changes.
fields.summary: Make change log available for customers

fields.description:
In OnDemand the search shortcut / has not been implemented 
[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA000/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts]
fields.summary: Implement slash-search shortcut

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Enable projects to use GreenHopper
* Search issues in a project
* On the result page, go Views > Charts
* The GreenHopper ones will not work
fields.summary: Greenhopper charts gadgets not working

fields.description:
Administration ... General Tab ... Look and Feel (*/secure/admin/jira/EditLookAndFeel!default.jspa) says "To restore system default for any single field, set that field to be blank, and click update." at the bottom when editing.  This doesn't actually work for the Gadget Colors section - leaving the entry for a given color blank results in the color being set to white (#FFFFFF).

As a workaround, the "Reset Defaults" button does restore all colors including Gadgets to their defaults.
fields.summary: Look and Feel Administration page does not reset to default color as expected

fields.description: Do you plan to add any support for compiling from workspaces instead of projects to the Bamboo Xcode plugin? Would be greatly appreciated!
fields.summary: Workspace support for Bamboo Xcode plugin

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
I have searched [https://studio.atlassian.com] for this plug-in request so that I can vote on it (as outlined in [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Third-Party+Plugin+Process]) and have been unsuccessful in finding a current issue/request.  

There seems to be an existing plug-in already developed [https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/226] and this is a request to add this to the plug-ins installed onto Jira Studio.
fields.summary: Visio Plug-in Request

fields.description:
Hi,

I'd like to request the addition of the Bamboo github plugin for Jira Studio

https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/9502
fields.summary: Add Bamboo github plugin to Jira Studio

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Create a test user
# Configure the user to only belong to the 'users' group
# Remove 'users' group from Confluence global permission, hence, 'users' group won't be able to use Confluence
# In the activity streams gadget in default JIRA dashboard, test user can still see Confluence activities (not expected). Clicking on the link yields 'Not Permitted' page (expected)
fields.summary: Activity Streams shows restricted content from Confluence

fields.description:
There are currently two locations to update/create/change a user avatar in OnDemand that are exposed to end users:
* The JIRA User Profile
* The wiki user settings

This is confusing for users as they expect to have one place to set their profile avatar (and possibly other information) across all the integrated applications in OnDemand. Please consider consolidating this activity into one area.
fields.summary: Consider consolidating profile/avatar configuration

fields.description:
* User with Admin access
* Access Administration > Issues > Plugins

The page has a text that seems to indicate the user would be able to install new plugins. It should rather has a link to our documentation explaining how plugins will be handled in OnDemand.
fields.summary: Manage Existing Plugins page has a link to  Atlassian Plugin Exchange which causes confusion

fields.description: When creating a patch review and selecting the "Paste text from clipboard" option, the "upload" button that is used to upload a patch file is still visible. I want to click it to confirm the text, but I get a file upload error. Is there a different way to "submit" the text?
fields.summary: Crucible patch reviews - "Paste text from clipboard" option does not work.

fields.description:
When I see the results of Filter (in issue navigator or on dashboards in gadgets), ex. "Issue = BFG-917" (for badooprojects.jira.com) - the due date is "28/Nov/11", but if I'll open it - there will be Due date = "29/Nov/11".

For some Issues the difference more than 1 day.

It is Very unusseful - We use Due Date to controll the launch dates for our features. Please fix it asap.
fields.summary: Last 2 days the "Due Date" is incorrect on the filters results

fields.description:
Can we please bundle Jira Scripting Suite with Atlassian OnDemand?

Plugin description: https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/16346?versionId=604958
fields.summary: Bundle Jira Scripting Suite with Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description: Resolution status is presently On or off. Meaning it is Unresolved if field is blank, and resolved if Field has a value. This does not allow for Resolution Statuses to be added such as "In Progress" or "In Test" where the resolution Status field could have a Value and not be "Resolved" yet. We have added some of these custom values. As soon as Resolution has a value, even a value we use for an issue that is not yet complete the incident ID shows a line through it. We wish to be able to determine which resolutions are considered "Resolved" and therefore trigger the Strike through
fields.summary: Wich to be able to have resolution statuses that count as unresolved

fields.description:
We created our own Workflow

Todo->In Progress->In Review->In Test->Ready For Release-> Released

Code is complete by the time a Card is moved to In Review. This where we would like it to be considered DONE. At anypoint after this if something fails it moves back to In Progress. But
#1. The documentation say the "DONE" column owns the definition of Done, but even if we change "In Review" to "DONE" it doesn't consider it Done
#2. regardless of title of the column GreenHopper considers the rightmost column as "DONE", the left most column as "To Do" and any columns no matter how many in between those as "In Progress". Green hopper lets us create our own Task board columns, but this definition of "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" based on column position means all graphs and charts are in accurate for our custom workflow.
fields.summary: wish to be able to configure which column in the Task board counts as done, not have it be based on column position
Google bar does not appear in OnDemand when only JIRA is enabled

fields.description: At present Atlassian OnDemand is set up to allow Google and other search engines to index it by default. It may be safer to run with the default of not allowing search engines to index Atlassian OnDemand instances.
fields.summary: Stop search engines from indexing Atlassian OnDemand instances by default

fields.description:
Request for customizable default values when creating a new project, especially:

- a custom notification scheme 
- a custom issue type scheme
- a custom workflow scheme

At the moment this involves repeated manual work for the customer
fields.summary: Customizable default schemes when creating new project

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
A request to bundle the Confluence Checklists Plugin: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CHK/Confluence+Checklists+Plugin
fields.summary: Bundle Confluence Checklists Plugin

fields.description:
In the Description field in JIRA, if the description contains the [pagename] of the Wiki, it will be able to link to the correct Wiki page. However, if the description contains [pagename#anchorname], the page will not be able to direct to the specific section where the anchor has placed on the wiki page.

For example, [Bug Report] will link to the correct wiki page: [https://hostname.jira.com/wiki/display/ABC/Bug+Report]. If JIRA tries to link to the anchor page of a wiki ([Bug+Report#5]) from an issue: ABC-123, the directed URL will be: [https://hostname.jira.com/display/ABC-123#anchorname]
fields.summary: Linking a JIRA Issue to an Anchor Page on a Wiki is Broken

fields.description:
Ok, this is a "weird one"

When you add a comment on an issue, that have the following pattern name-rNUMBER.foo.bar, the encoding will shown something like https://test-tok17-inline-tok.foo.bar

Reproduced in:
* The user instance - Studio Legacy
* On our test instance(brazil.jira-dev.com) - OnDemand

Did not reproduced
* Local Jira 4.2
* Local Jira 4.4
* Local Jira 4.4.1
** (Both of them, using Postgres as db)
* "Jira Only" instances(SAC..)
fields.summary: Wrong encoding when url contains name hyphen r number

fields.description:
I would like to be able to use the Custom HTML Plugin & the HTML Macro with my Confluence OnDemand instance. I know from [this issue|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-2496], there are security concerns with the plugin, so I suppose the focus of this feature request is to for the development team to mitigate the XSS attack vector. 

I envision a solution that would involve server-side code to filter out the User-HTML-Block whenever a page is viewed by users with elevated privileged. I don't know a whole lot about XSS attacks, but is it not the case that the malicious JavaScript must be executed client-side for the attack to work? If the User-HTML is filtered out, then the JavaScript can't execute. 

Ultimately, I want to use Custom HTML to include JavaScript snippets from various web services like DISQUS & Google Analytics, and the HTML macro for including raw HTML.

I suppose an alternative solution would be a series of plugins & macros similar to the Widget macro that would render predefined JavaScript snippets. That does solve my raw HTML issue.
fields.summary: Enable Custom HTML plugin for Confluence Cloud

fields.description: Currently the number of users for the main product license and the add-on license must match, so for example a 25 user instance of JIRA requires a 25 user license for Greenhopper but some customers might only want to have 10 Greenhopper users and 25 JIRA users so this request is to ask that this type of flexibility in licensing is considered for a future version of the OnDemand licensing scheme.
fields.summary: Allow separate user license counts for OnDemand applications and add-ons

fields.description:
Error messages misleading the customer when trying to add users and/or changing their access level:

Quote from customer:

"This is the error message:

Edit User Groups
This page lets you edit group memberships for a user.

Errors

Adding the user to the groups you have selected will grant the 'JIRA
Users' permission to the user in JIRA. This will exceed the number of users
allowed to use JIRA under your license. Please reduce the number of users
with the 'JIRA Users', 'JIRA Administrators' or 'JIRA System
Administrators' global permissions or consider upgrading your license.


I (customer) found the problem with it - it has been set before to Developer as a
work-around for the problem we had before. On the page I tried to add users
group, there was no mentioning about what type of user this one would be.
The error message didn't include any reference to that.

Good thing it seems sorted now.
As a feedback - better message would help to track the cause of the error,
also hint to go and edit the person access level (with a link) would help
as well.
The user profile page has no edit link on it, as anyone would expect."
fields.summary: Change error messages so they point to the solution

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Hi, 

I'm product manager for plugin SQLFeed(Valiantys) and we would like our plugin to be bundle with JIRA Studio. 
https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/23337

Thanks, 

Alice
fields.summary: Bundle SQLFeed plugin to Atlassian OnDemand

Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Hi, 

I'm product manager for plugin VertygoSLA (Valiantys) and we would like our plugin to be bundle with JIRA Studio. 
https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/9041

Thanks,
fields.summary: Bundle VertygoSLA plugin to Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description:
It appears that an admin user must have application access to FishEye in order to login to WebDAV.

Steps to reproduce:
- provision an instance with all applications,
- create an admin user (they will just have access to JIRA),
- attempt to login to WebDAV (it will fail),
- give user app access to FishEye,
- attempt login to WebDAV (it will succeed).

Note that this even seems to be the case for accounts that do not have FishEye.
fields.summary: Administrators require application access to FishEye in order to access WebDAV

fields.description:
See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-27116.

Although the SVN importer runs the actual import of an svn repo outside of Java (and thus uses mainly native memory for this), after the repository has been staged, the importer checks that the repository structure matches the expected structure (1 directory for each project, and a trunk/tags/branches path structure for each project). To do this check, the importer gets a full repository file listing by executing "svnlook tree <path to repo>" and reading this into memory.

If the list returned by "svnlook tree <path to repo>" is extremely large (only happened to one customer so far with Xmx=512m), jira will OOM. 

Unfortunately, there is no easy way to limit the depth of the results returned by "svnlook tree" or the equivalent "svn list". We only need the depth to two levels to do the checks that we need to do (in DoesRepoMatchProjectStructure.java), but at present we are reading in the whole repository list in order to do so.

If more customers run into this problem, we can modify the DoesRepoMatchProjectStructure class to:
  1. run "svnlook tree <path to repo> -R --depth immediates" to get the first level directories. Check that each of these exactly match the list of projects.
  2. in each of the project directories, run "svnlook tree <path to repo> -R --depth immediates" and ensure that they have the "trunk", "branches" and "tags" directories.

This is definitely a bit cumbersome, and may be a bit slower, but it will avoid reading the whole repository list into memory.
fields.summary: SVN importer OOMs when trying to import a repository with a very large file tree
